Package com.datamelt.rules.implementation

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    CheckConstants  
    CheckContains
    Checks if a string is contained in another string.
    CheckDateTimeIsBetween
    Checks if the time part of a date is between two given times.
    CheckDistanceIsEqual
    Checks if the Levenshtein distance between two strings is equal to a given value.
    CheckDistanceIsGreater
    Checks if the Levenshtein distance between two strings is greater than a given value.
    CheckDistanceIsGreaterOrEqual
    Checks if the Levenshtein distance between two strings is greater or equal to a given value.
    CheckDistanceIsSmaller
    Checks if the Levenshtein distance between two strings is smaller than a given value.
    CheckDistanceIsSmallerOrEqual
    Checks if the Levenshtein distance between two strings is smaller or equal to a given value.
    CheckEndsWith
    Checks if a string ends with a given other string.
    CheckIsBetween
    Checks if one number is between two given other numbers - including the upper and lower limit.
    CheckIsEmpty
    Checks if a string is empty meaning: it is of zero length and is NOT null.
    CheckIsEqual
    Checks if a given string is equal to another string, if two numbers are equal or if two dates are equal.
    CheckIsEven
    Checks if a given number is an even number The first parameter of a given method is always the value of the field that shall be checked.
    CheckIsGreater
    Checks if one value is greater than the other value.
    CheckIsGreaterOrEqual
    Checks if one value is greater or equal compared to the other value.
    CheckIsInList
    Checks if the given string value is contained in a list of values separated by comma.
    CheckIsLowercase
    checks if a given value contains lowercase characters only.
    CheckIsNegativeNumber
    checks if a given value is smaller than zero (0).
    CheckIsNotBetween
    Checks if one number is not between two given other numbers - excluding the upper and lower limit.
    CheckIsNotEmpty
    Checks if a string is not empty meaning: it is not of zero length and is NOT null.
    CheckIsNotEqual
    Checks if a given string is not equal to another string, if two numbers are not equal or if two dates are not equal.
    CheckIsNotEven
    Checks if a given number is not an even number The first parameter of a given method is always the value of the field that shall be checked.
    CheckIsNotInList
    Checks if the given string value is not contained in a list of values separated by comma.
    CheckIsNotNegativeNumber
    checks if a given value is greater or equal to zero (0).
    CheckIsNotNull
    checks if a given value is NOT NULL or - in case of a string value - checks if its value is not equal to the string 'null' or 'Null'.
    CheckIsNotPrime
    checks if a given integer is not a prime number The first parameter of a given method is always the value of the field that shall be checked.
    CheckIsNull
    checks if a given value is NULL or - in case of a string value - checks if its value is equal to the string 'null' or 'Null'.
    CheckIsNumeric
    checks if a given string value is numeric by checking if all characters are numbers.
    CheckIsPrime
    checks if a given integer is a prime number The first parameter of a given method is always the value of the field that shall be checked.
    CheckIsSmaller
    Checks if one value is smaller than the other value.
    CheckIsSmallerOrEqual
    Checks if one value is smaller or equal compared to the other value.
    CheckIsUppercase
    checks if a given value contains uppercase characters only.
    CheckLength
    checks, if the length of the given value (number of digits/characters) is equal to the given length.
    CheckListHasMember
    Checks if a list of string values separated by commas contains a given string.
    CheckListNotHasMember
    checks if a string containing multiple values separated by commas (,) not contains a given string. spaces between the individual values are removed (trim) an example for a list would be: "Rome, Paris, New York, Berlin" The first argument of a method is always the value of the field that one wants to check.
    CheckMatches
    checks if a string of characters matches a given pattern.
    CheckNotContains
    checks if a given value does not contain another value.
    CheckNotEndsWith
    Checks if a string does not end with a given other string.
    CheckNotMatches
    checks if a string of characters does not match a given pattern.
    CheckNotSoundsLike
    checks if a string does not sound like a given string using the soundex algorithm.
    CheckNotStartsWith
    Checks if a string does not start with a given other string.
    CheckSoundsLike
    checks if a string sounds like a given string using the soundex algorithm.
    CheckStartsWith
    Checks if a string starts with a given other string.
    GenericCheck
    this class is the base class of all classes that check certain conditions in regards to provided values
